description:
+49° 29' 51.02", -56° 5' 15.51"
This is a 6K interpretive trail with three access points bordering along the Indian River and some associated roads through the community of Springdale. The trail is gravel laid, with benches, boardwalks and stair systems to suit the terrain. A bridge crosses Indian River at one point, and at one end, a small waterfall is home to a salmon ladder. There, the history of the river is explained.  At the other end, a long railed boardwalk meanders along the river?s shore grasses.
The RIverwood Inn is also a spot the trail trips through, so if you?re staying there, you?ll have a great place for your morning or evening strolls, offering great scenic views of the river.
Shannon Burt
East Coast editor
NOTE:  The attached GPS data is only the SouthEast 1/3 of the trail, there is another 5 km to the West.
directions: From route 390, look for Circlular Drive on your right as you enter Springdale. Follow the signs to Riverwood Inn, and along the road, you will see the signage for the Indian River Trail. +49° 29' 51.02", -56° 5' 15.51"
title: Riverwood Trail (Indian River Walking Trail)
